DataElement.preferredName: Patient Residence Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of patient residence as curated for the Radiation Therapy Oncology Group (RTOG) which is a multi-institutional cooperative organization, a national cancer study research group comprised of 250 of the major research institutions nationally and in Canada, funded by NCI, headquartered in Philadelphia with almost 30 years of experience in running clinical trials.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the residence (the place where a person lives) of a patient (a person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Residence; the place where a person lives.

Concepts.definition: Any address at which a person dwells more than temporarily.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The Radiation Therapy Oncology Group (RTOG) is a multi-institutional cooperative organization, a national cancer study research group comprised of 250 of the major research institutions nationally and in Canada, funded by NCI, headquartered in Philadelphia with almost 30 years of experience in running clinical trials. More than 40 clinical trials that involve radiation therapy either alone or in conjunction with surgery and/or chemotherapeutic drugs are active at any one time within RTOG. The group is interested in quality of life issues and their effects on the cancer patient:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A multi-institutional cooperative organization, a national cancer study research group comprised of 250 of the major research institutions nationally and in Canada, funded by NCI, headquartered in Philadelphia with almost 30 years of experience in running clinical trials. More than 40 clinical trials that involve radiation therapy either alone or in conjunction with surgery and/or chemotherapeutic drugs are active at any one time within RTOG. The group is interested in quality of life issues and their effects on the cancer patient
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
